sen.j: 大和物語（やまとものがたり）は、平安時代に成立した中古日本の物語である。
sen.e: Yamato Monogatari (literally, "Tales of Yamato") is a story of the Middle Ages of Japan, written in the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Yamato Monogatari (literally, "Tales of Yamato") is a story of the Middle Ages of Japan, written in the Heian period.
Yamato Monogatari (literally, "Tales of Yamato") is a story of the Middle Ages of Japan, written in the Heian period.

sen.j: 当時の貴族社会の歌語りを中心とした歌物語である。
sen.e: Yamato Monogatari is an uta-monogatari (poem-tale) based on the poems composed by the members of the aristocratic society.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Yamato Monogatari is an uta-monogatari (poem-tale) based on the poems composed by the members of the aristocratic society.

sen.j: 天暦5年（951年）頃までに執筆されたと推定されている。
sen.e: It is presumed that this literary work had already been accomplished by about 951.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It is presumed that this literary work had already been accomplished by about 951.
It is presumed that this literary work had already been accomplished by about 951.

sen.j: 歌物語の性格上登場人物は実名・官名・女房名で登場し具体的にある固定の人物を指していることが多い。
sen.e: From its property as an uta-monogatari, the characters in the story were often written by using their real name, official position or title or nyobo-na (name as a court lady), referring to certain existing or existed people specifically.

sen.j: 『伊勢物語』の影響のもとに成立した作品とされている。
sen.e: It is believed that this literary work was influenced by "Ise Monogatari" (literally, "Tales of Ise," an uta-monogatari in the mid Heian period).
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It is believed that this literary work was influenced by "Ise Monogatari" (literally, "Tales of Ise," an uta-monogatari in the mid Heian period).

sen.j: 「大和国」の名は「伊勢国」に対する命名であると言われている。
sen.e: The title of this literary work "Yamato Monogatari" is also believed to have been named after 'Yamato Province,' following 'Ise Monogatari' named after 'Ise Province.'
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The title of this literary work "Yamato Monogatari" is also believed to have been named after 'Yamato Province,' following 'Ise Monogatari' named after 'Ise Province.'

sen.j: しかし、大和という名の女房の手になる物語とする説もある。
sen.e: On the other hand, there is a theory that the title of this literary work was named after the author, a nyobo (a court lady) Yamato.

sen.j: 成立
sen.e: Accomplishment
Accomplishment

sen.j: 平安時代前期、『伊勢物語』の成立後で、村上天皇の御世、950年ごろと推定されている。
sen.e: Accomplishment of this literary work is estimated at around 950 during the reign of the Emperor Murakami, in the early Heian period, following the accomplishment of "Ise Monogatari."
Accomplishment of this literary work is estimated at around 950 during the reign of the Emperor Murakami, in the early Heian period, following the accomplishment of "Ise Monogatari."

sen.j: 作者
sen.e: Author
Author

sen.j: 『大和物語』の実作者は古くは、在原滋春・花山天皇が擬せられたが、現在に至るまで未詳である。
sen.e: ARIWARA no Shigeharu and the Emperor Kazan were purported to be the authors of "Yamato Monogatari" previously, but the truth has not been found out yet.
ARIWARA no Shigeharu and the Emperor Kazan were purported to be the authors of "Yamato Monogatari" previously, but the truth has not been found out yet.
ARIWARA no Shigeharu and the Emperor Kazan were purported to be the authors of "Yamato Monogatari" previously, but the truth has not been found out yet.

sen.j: 宇多天皇や周辺の人物が話題になることが多く、宇多天皇の身辺に侍っていた女房が関わっているらしい。
sen.e: It seems that a nyobo serving near the Emperor Uda was concerned with the production of this literary work, because it includes a lot of subjects on the Emperor Uda and his surrounding people.

sen.j: 通説では、全173段に区切られている。
sen.e: The common accepted theory suggests that this literary work consists of 173 chapters in total.

sen.j: 約三百首の和歌が含まれている。
sen.e: It includes about 300 poems.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It includes about 300 poems.
It includes about 300 poems.

sen.j: しかし『伊勢物語』とは異なり統一的な主人公はおらず、各段ごとに和歌にまつわる説話や、当時の天皇・貴族・僧ら実在の人物による歌語りが連なった歌物語の集成となっている。
sen.e: However, without setting a specific leading character like "Ise Monogatari," this literary work collects narrative relating to Japanese Poems and uta-monogatari consisting of a series of poems composed by real people like emperors, nobles, Buddhist monks in those days, each of which is compiled in a chapter.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, without setting a specific leading character like "Ise Monogatari," this literary work collects narrative relating to Japanese Poems and uta-monogatari consisting of a series of poems composed by real people like emperors, nobles, Buddhist monks in those days, each of which is compiled in a chapter.

However, without setting a specific leading character like "Ise Monogatari," this literary work collects narratives relating to waka poems and uta-monogatari consisting of a series of poems composed by real people like emperors, nobles, Buddhist priests in those days, each of which is compiled in a chapter.
sen.cmt: 和歌 を追加しました。

sen.j: 内容・構成
sen.e: Content and composition
Content and composition
Content and composition

sen.j: 第146段までの前半は（物語成立の）近年に詠まれた歌を核として、皇族貴族たちがその由来を語る歌語りとなっている。
sen.e: The first half through the 146th chapter consists of poems composed around the period when the literary work was accomplished, as well as commentaries made by the Imperial family and nobles on the origin of those poems.

The first half through the 146th chapter consists of poems composed around the period when the literary work was accomplished, as well as commentaries made by the Imperial family and nobles on the origin of those poems.

The first half through the 146th chapter consists of poems composed around the period when the literary work was accomplished, as well as commentaries made by the Imperial family and nobles on the origin of those poems.

sen.j: 後半は、悲恋や離別、再会など人の出会いと歌を通した古い民間伝説が語られており、説話的要素の強い内容になっている。
sen.e: The latter half consists of old folklore including poems whose theme is an encounter with others through tragic love, separation, reunion and so on, having a strong characteristics of narrative elements.

The latter half consists of old folklore including poems whose theme is an encounter with others through tragic love, separation, reunion and so on, having strong characteristics of narrative elements.

The latter half consists of old folklore including poems whose theme is an encounter with others through tragic love, separation, reunion and so on, having strong characteristics of narrative elements.

sen.j: 二人から求婚された乙女が生田川に身を投げる「生田川伝説」（147段）や、「姥捨山伝説」（156段）などである。
sen.e: It includes 'a legend of Ikuta-gawa River' (the 147th chapter) with a story that a young lady committed suicide by throwing herself into Ikuta-gawa River for taking to heart the propositions of marriage from two men, as well as 'a legend of Ubasute-yama Mountain' (the 156th chapter).

It includes 'a legend of Ikuta-gawa River' (the 147th chapter) with a story about a young lady who committed suicide by throwing herself into Ikuta-gawa River for taking to heart the propositions of marriage from two men, as well as 'a legend of Ubasute-yama Mountain' (the 156th chapter).

sen.j: 『伊勢物語』にあらわれる「筒井筒」と同じ話が『大和物語』にも出てくるなど、『伊勢物語』の影響は色濃い。
sen.e: The literary work was strongly influenced by "Ise Monogatari," which is suggested in the matter that the same story as 'Tsutsuizutsu' (curb of a well) included in 'Ise Monogatari' is also included in "Yamato Monogatari."

The literary work was strongly influenced by "Ise Monogatari," which is suggested in the matter that the same story as 'Tsutsuizutsu' (curb of a well) included in 'Ise Monogatari' is also included in "Yamato Monogatari."

sen.j: 『後撰和歌集』や凡河内躬恒の『躬恒集』などの和歌が『大和物語』出てくることから、何らかの関係がある。
sen.e: Furthermore, it is supposed that "Yamato Monogatari" may have some relations with "Gosen Wakashu" (selected collection of Japanese poetry) and "Mitsune's Poetry Book" compiled by OSHIKOCHI no Mitsune, because some poems in these books appears in "Yamato Monogatari."

Furthermore, it is supposed that "Yamato Monogatari" may have some relations with "Gosen Wakashu" (selected collection of Japanese poetry) and "Mitsune's Poetry Book" compiled by OSHIKOCHI no Mitsune, because some poems in these books appear in "Yamato Monogatari."
